courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Special Physical Education I

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing and nurturing students with disabled conditions or special health problems the concepts of sports activities participation and choosing some sports activities for life long participation. Content includes: recognizing the foundation and principles of Physical Education, participating in light exercises and physical conditioning, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1.      Introduction of the usage of fitness equipment  
2.      Practice of walking/ jogging and fitness exercises  
3.      Introduction and practice of stretching exercises  
4.      Introduction of fitness concepts  
5.      Introduction and practice of mild games  
6.      Group discussion and presentation  
  
  
教學內容  
1.        健身室使用法之介紹  
2.        步行/慢跑及健身室健身鍛鍊  
3.        伸展操之介紹及練習  
4.        體適能概念之介紹  
5.        輕巧運動之介紹及練習  
6.        分組討論及專題報告

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Track and Field
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students’ fundamental skills of track and field, arousing students’ interests towards athletics and nurturing initiative of physical activities which are needed for lifelong participation in the sports activities. Content include: techniques, postures and rules of running, jumping and throwing events, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc..
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
Not for students who have taken PHED1310.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. General sports knowledge and safety of track and field events  
2. Basic skills of sprint (start, acceleration and finish techniques)  
3. Basic skills of shot put (shot from a standing position facing forward, sideway and using the glide technique)  
4. Basic skills of long jump (arm and leg actions of the hang technique in the aerial phase and landing phase)  
5. Basic skills of javelin (methods of gripping the javelin and the release of the throw)  
6. Introduction and practice of high jump and hurdles  
  
  
教學內容  
1. 基本運動知識及田徑運動安全守則  
2. 短跑基本技巧 (起跑、中途跑及最後衝刺之技巧)  
3. 沿球基本技巧 (正向原地推球、側向原地推球及背向原地推球)  
4. 跳遠基本技巧 (助跑、騰空動作及落地方法)  
5. 標槍基本技巧 (握槍、持槍方法及最後出槍動作)  
6. 跳高及跨欄介紹及練習
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Feedback from students to be collected via course-end evaluation.  
Feedback from students to be collected during the course informally by the teachers.  
Feedback from students to be collected informally via e-mail and CU eLearning System.
courses.recommended_readings:
1. IAAF. (2009). Run! Jump! Throw! The official IAAF Guide to Teaching Athletics. Lincolnshire: Warners.

2. USATF. (2014). Track & Field Coaching Essentials. Champaign, IL: Human Kinetics.

3. IAAF. (2008). Track and Field Facilities Manual. Monaco: International Association of Athletics Federations.

4. Strüder, H., Jonath, U., & Scholz, K. (2023). Track & Field: Training & Movement Science-Theory and Practice for All Disciplines. Meyer & Meyer Sport.

5. 中國田徑協會 編 2009 中國青少年田徑教學訓練大綱，北京體育大學出版社.

6. 李立群  陳新民 主編 2009 田徑裁判員培訓與晉級教程，北京體育大學出版社.

7. 王興林 編著 2009 田徑運動概論，北京科學出版社.

8. 美國田徑運動協會 編，劉江南等 編譯 2002美國田徑訓練指南，人民體育出版社.

中國香港田徑總會(HKAAA)    http://www.hkaaa.com/

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at increasing students’ knowledge of swimming and providing choices for physical activities participation. Contents include: freestyle and breaststroke swimming skills, water safety and basic rules of swimming competition, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
Not for students who have taken PHED1020.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1.   History of swimming  
2.   Introduction of water safety and personal hygiene  
3.   Basic rules of swimming competition   
4.   Basic skills of freestyle (Arms and legs actions, coordination of arms, legs and breathing for the whole style)   
5.   Basic skills of breaststroke (Arms and legs actions, coordination of arms, legs and breathing for the whole style)  
6.   Basic skills of water treading  
   
教學內容  
1.   游泳簡史  
2.   游泳安全及個人衛生  
3.   比賽常規  
4.   自由泳之基本動作(手腳、腿部動作、手腳協調動作及與呼吸之配合)  
5.   蛙泳之基本動作(手腳、腿部動作、手腳協調動作及與呼吸之配合)  
6.   踩水之基本動作

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students’ fundamental fitness concepts and an option as a lifelong physical activity. Contents of this course include basic concepts of physical fitness, exercise safety, basic techniques of using fitness room facilities, basic principles of exercise prescription, basic knowledge and techniques of fitness testing, basic knowledge to choose the appropriate exercise mode and design fitness programmes, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward lifelong physical activity participation etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
Not for students who have taken PHED1220.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. Explain the definition of Health-related Physical Fitness and its effect  
2. Introduction and practice of warm-ups and stretching exercises on major muscle groups  
3. Introduction and training methods of aerobic exercise  
4. Introduction and practice of jogging and cool down exercises  
5. Introduction of safety, rules and regulations of using fitness room  
6. Introduction and practicum of aerobic machines and resistance training equipment  
7. Explaining the concepts of Body Composition and Weight Control  
8. Introduction of the Principles of Interval Training and Circuit Training  
9. Exercise Prescription of Cardio-respiratory Endurance and Muscular Fitness (FITT)  
10. Introduction of the Concept of “Life Long Activity” and implementation of a Personal Exercise Prescription Programme  
  
教學內容  
1. 說明健康體適能的意義及功效  
2. 熱身運動介紹及身體各主要肌群伸展之介紹及練習  
3. 有氧運動介紹及鍛鍊方法  
4. 緩步跑及緩和運動之介紹和練習  
5. 健身室安全使用守則之介紹  
6. 健身室器械之介紹和實習  
7. 解釋身體肥瘦組合及體重控制的概念  
8. 間歇訓練及循環訓練原理之介紹及實習  
9. 介紹心肺耐力及肌肉適能的運動處方(FITT)  
10.「終生運動」概念的介紹及個人運動處方的安排和實踐
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Feedback from students to be collected via course-end evaluation.  
Feedback from students to be collected during the course informally by the lecturers.  
Feedback from students to be collected formally via e-mail and CU eLearning System.
courses.recommended_readings:
1. Alter M. J. (2004). Science of Flexibility. Champaign, IL: Human Kinetics.

2. American College of Sports Medicine. (2022). American College of Sports Medicine. https://www.acsm.org/

3. Caspersen, C. J., Powell, K. E., & Christenson, G. M. (1985). Physical activity, exercise, and physical fitness: definitions and distinctions for health-related research. Public Health Reports, 100(2), 126-131.

4. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. (1999). Physical Activity and Health: A Report of the Surgeon General.

https://www.cdc.gov/nccdphp/sgr/index.htm

5. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. (2022). Physical Activity Basics.     https://www.cdc.gov/physicalactivity/basics/index.htm

6. Corbin, C. B., & Pangrazi, R. P. (1998). Physical activity pyramid rebuffs peak experience. ACSM's Health & Fitness Journal, 2(1), 12-17.

7. Exercise is Medicine (2022). Exercise is Medicine.https://www.exerciseismedicine.org/

8. Klika, B., & Jordan, C. (2013). High-intensity circuit training using body weight: Maximum results with minimal investment. ACSM’s Health & Fitness Journal, 17(3), 8-13.

9. Liguori, G., American College of Sports Medicine. (2021). ACSM’s Guidelines for Exercise Testing and Prescription. Philadelphia, PA: Wolters Kluwer.

10. Physical Education Unit, The Chinese University of Hong Kong. (2016). Guidelines for Resistance Training. http://www.peu.cuhk.edu.hk/images/content/pe-courses/fitness-guidelines.pdf

11. Physical Education Unit, The Chinese University of Hong Kong. (2024). E-booklet of Skill-related Stretching.

http://www.peu.cuhk.edu.hk/zh-tw/pe-courses/stretching

12. Physical Fitness Association of Hong Kong, China. (2024). Physical Fitness Association of Hong Kong, China.

http://www.hkpfa.org.hk/index/customIndex.aspx?nnnid=1

13. U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (2024). Healthy People 2030.

https://health.gov/healthypeople

14. 王怡璇 (譯) 〈2010〉。《運動解剖書》(原作者﹕P., Manocchia)。台灣﹕木馬文化 (原作出版年﹕2009)

15. 中國香港體適能總會〈2017〉。《器械健體導師手冊》。香港：中國香港體適能總會。

16. 中國香港體適能總會〈2017〉。《體適能導師綜合理論》。香港：中國香港體適能總會。

17. 阮伯仁，沈劍威〈2006〉。《體適能基礎理論》（第二版）。香港：中國香港體適能總會。

18. 林正常〈2002〉。《運動科學與訓練》。台灣：銀禾文化事業有限公司。

19. 許世全〈2015〉。《實用體適能測試與評估》。香港：陳湘記圖書有限公司。

20. 許育達，陳壹豪，應充明，鄭明昇（譯）〈2014〉。《核心訓練圖解聖經》（原作者：Dorling Kindersley Ltd）。台灣：旗標科技股份有限公司。（原作出版年：2013）

4. 緩步跑及緩和運動之介紹和練習  
5. 健身室安全使用守則之介紹  
6. 健身室器械之介紹和實習  
7. 解釋身體肥瘦組合及體重控制的概念  
8. 間歇訓練及循環訓練原理之介紹及實習  
9. 介紹心肺耐力及肌肉適能的運動處方(FITT)  
10.「終生運動」概念的介紹及個人運動處方的安排和實踐

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Swimming
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at increasing students’ knowledge of swimming and providing choices for physical activities participation. Contents include: freestyle and breaststroke swimming skills, water safety and basic rules of swimming competition, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
Not for students who have taken PHED1015 and PHED1016.
courses.learning_outcomes:
At the end of the course, students are able to  
1. Swim 50m freestyle or 50m breaststroke  
2. acquire sports general knowledge  
3. acquire basic knowledge of water safety  
4. acquire basic rules of swimming competition  
5. demonstrate positive attitudes and values towards sports participation  
  
完成游泳科目後，學生能夠  
1. 游畢50米自由或蛙泳  
2. 掌握基本運動常識  
3. 掌握水上安全要點  
4. 掌握游泳比賽基本規則  
5. 展示對參與運動的正面態度及價值觀
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
  
1.   History of swimming  
2.   Introduction of water safety and personal hygiene  
3.   Basic rules of swimming competition   
4.   Basic skills of freestyle (Arms and legs actions, coordination of arms, legs and breathing for the whole style)   
5.   Basic skills of breaststroke (Arms and legs actions, coordination of arms, legs and breathing for the whole style)  
6.   Basic skills of water treading   
  
教學內容  
1.   游泳簡史  
2.   游泳安全及個人衛生  
3.   比賽常規  
4.   自由泳之基本動作(手腳、腿部動作、手腳協調動作及與呼吸之配合)  
5.   蛙泳之基本動作(手腳、腿部動作、手腳協調動作及與呼吸之配合)  
6.   踩水之基本動作

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. This course aims at developing students' fundamental skills of Basketball needed for lifelong participation in the sport. Contents include: footwork, passing, dribbling, shooting, defensive skill, tactics and rules of the game, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. History of basketball, introduction of basketball court and equipment  
2. Footwork, ball sense exercise and different pass and receiving skills  
3. Dribbling (High, Control and Cross dribble)  
4. Set shots and jump shots (one-hand and two-hand)  
5. Drive and lay-up shots  
6. Skills of blocking and rebounding  
7. Introduction of low post skills  
8. Basic passing game (Give-and-go, Penetrate & pass, Screening and Flash)  
9. Basic tactics in defensive situation (Squeeze, fight, over, slide through, help, trap and recover)  
10. Introduction of basic rules (violation & foul), referee signals and refereeing  
  
教學內容  
1. 籃球簡史、球場及球具之介紹  
2. 籃球步法、球感練習及各種傳接球技術  
3. 運球（高運球、低運球、體前變向運球）  
4. 原地及跳起投籃（單手及雙手）  
5. 運球上籃技術（單手低手及單手肩上）  
6. 搶位及籃板球技術  
7. 底位球員動作介紹及練習  
8. 基礎戰術配合（傳切配合、突分配合、掩護配合及策應配合）  
9. 基礎防守配合（擠過、穿過、繞過配合、關門、夾擊及補防）  
10. 球例、基本球証手號及球証裁判法之介紹

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. This course aims at developing students’ fundamental skills of Volleyball needed for life long participation in the game. Contents include: services, upper hand passes, underhand passes, blockings, jump spikes, rules and tactics of the game, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1.     History of volleyball and introduction of volleyball court, equipment and safety  
2.     Volleyball passing skills (overhand and underhand)  
3.     Volleyball serving skills (overhand and underhand)  
4.     Serve receiving skills  
5.     Digging, spiking and blocking skills   
6.     Basic footwork   
7.     Introduction of players’ positions and their duties    
8.     Introduction of refereeing, rules and scoring  
9.     Introduction of volleyball offensive and defensive strategies and different formations  
   
教學內容  
1.    排球簡史、球場介紹、球具及安全守則  
2.    排球傳球技巧 (上手和下手)  
3.    排球發球技巧 (上手和下手)  
4.    接發球技巧  
5.    扣球、救球及欄網技巧  
6.    基本步法  
7.    各球員位置及其職責之介紹  
8.    比賽球例、裁判法及計分法之介紹  
9.  排球攻防戰術及不同陣型之介紹

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students’ basic concepts of softball needed for lifelong participation in the sports activities. Contents include: the knowledge of softball basic rules and regulations, basic softball offensive skills, basic softball defensive skills, proper use of equipment, basic offensive and defensive strategies, nurture positive attitudes and values toward lifelong exercise habits, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. History of softball and introduction of softball field and equipment  
2. Introduction of basic throwing skills (overhead throw, sidearm throw and underhand throw)  
3. Introduction of basic catching skills (catching ground ball and fly ball)  
4. Catching and pitching practice  
5. Introduction of batting and bunting  
6. Introduction of base running technique  
7. Introduction and practice of offensive and defensive strategies  
8. Introduction of softball competition rules and team formation  
  
教學內容  
1. 壘球簡史、球場及球具之介紹  
2. 基本傳球技術之介紹 (肩上傳球、側臂傳球及低手傳球)  
3. 基本接球技術之介紹 (滾地球及高飛球)  
4. 捕手及投手的傳接球練習  
5. 擊球及觸擊球之動作介紹  
6. 跑壘技術之介紹  
7. 壘球進攻及防守技術之介紹及練習  
8. 壘球比賽規則及隊伍組織之介紹

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. This course aims to develop students’ fundamental skills of Handball needed for lifelong participation in the sport. Contents include: the basic skills of handball, the basic rules of handball, the basic knowledge of offensive and defensive strategies, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
courses.learning_outcomes:
At the end of the course, students are able to

1. demonstrate the basic skills of Handball.

2. acquire general knowledge of sport.

3. acquire knowledge of the basic rules, scoring, terminology, equipment and safety of Handball

4. acquire knowledge of offensive and defensive strategies.

5. demonstrate positive attitudes and values toward sports participation.

完成手球課程後，學生能夠  
1. 展示基本手球運動技術；  
2. 掌握基本運動常識；  
3. 掌握手球運動基本規則、計分法、名詞、安全守則及設備；  
4. 掌握攻防戰術的基本知識；  
5. 展示對參與運動的正面態度及價值觀。
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content

1. History of handball and introduction of handball court and equipment

2. Basic footwork (Cross Step, Side Step and Slide Step)

3. Ball holding and passing exercise (Overarm Pass, Wrist Pass, Bounce Pass, Distance throw)

4. Individual offense and defense techniques

5. Introduction of basic shooting skills (including penalty shot, left/right wing shot, centre shot, left/ right rotate shot and jump shot)

6. Introduction and practice of angle-blocking and fast break by goalkeeper

7. Introduction and practice of offense and defense tactics of handball

教學內容:

1. 手球簡史、球場及球具之介紹

2. 各種基本步法介紹(交叉步、墊步、橫跨步)

3. 持球及傳球練習 (肩上傳球、側手傳球、彈地傳球、擲遠)

4. 個人基本防守及進攻動作

5. 基本射門介紹及練習(包括左，右翼及中樞射門、左，右迴旋射門及躍起射門等)

6. 守門員基本動作、封位及發動快攻之介紹及練習

7. 手球防守/進攻戰術介紹及實習
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Feedback from students to be collected via course-end evaluation.  
Feedback from students to be collected during the course informally by the teachers.  
Feedback from students to be collected informally via e-mail and CU eLearning System.
courses.recommended_readings:
1. 邵天諾、楊華照(2006) 。《基礎手球》。澳門：澳門理工學院。

2. Reita E. Clanton, Mary Phy Dwight. (2013). Team Handball: Steps to Success. United States : Human Kinetics.

3. Radu, F.L., & Abalasei, B.A. (2015). 101 Team handball. London: Bloomsbury.

4. 洪海蕭 (2020) 。《全新正版 全民健身计划系列丛书-手球 分步详解体育健身书籍》。吉林出版集團股份有限公司。

5. 中國香港手球總會  http://www.handball.org.hk

6. International Handball Federation  www.ihf.info

7. Asian Handball Federation  http://www.asianhandball.org/index.php?lang=en

8. Estriga, L. (2019). Team Handball: Teaching and Learning Step-by-Step. United States:United States: Agência Nacional.

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. This course aims to develop students' fundamental skills of Soccer needed for lifelong participation in the sport. Contents include: dribbling, passing, heading, shooting, goal keeping, defensive footwork, rules and tactics of the sport, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. History of football and introduction of football court and equipment  
2. Common ways for soccer warm-up and ball sense practice  
3. Basic soccer skills (including ball passing, trapping and controlling, dribbling, heading and shooting, etc.)  
4. Defensive techniques (defensive pressure and filling the space created by attackers)  
5. Throw-in technique, corner kick and free kick techniques  
6. Introduction of goalkeeping techniques and different players’ positions and roles  
7. Introduction of soccer formations and tactics in different matches (5, 7 or 11-a-side)  
  
教學內容  
1. 足球簡史、球場及球具之介紹  
2. 足球常用熱身及球感練習  
3. 各種足球技巧 (包括傳球、停控球、運球、頭球及射門等)  
4. 防守技術 (壓迫及補位)  
5. 界外球、角球及罰球技巧  
6. 基本守門員技術介紹及其他球員位置及職責之介紹  
7. 介紹各比賽 (5人、7人及11人) 的陣式及戰術

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing and nurturing students with disabled conditions or special health problems the concepts of sports activities participation and choosing some sports activities for life long participation. Content includes: recognizing the foundation and principles of Physical Education, participating in light exercises and physical conditioning, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:

courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1.          Practice of walking/ jogging and fitness exercises  
2.          Practice of throwing and catching  
3.          Introduction and practice of lawn bowl  
4.          Introduction and practice of wood ball  
5.          Introduction and practice of table tennis  
6.          Introduction of general sports knowledge  
7.          Group discussion and presentation  
  
  
教學內容  
1.    步行/慢跑及健身室健身鍛鍊  
2.    傳接運動之介紹及練習  
3.    草地滾球之介紹及練習  
4.    活木球之介紹及練習  
5.    乒乓球之介紹及練習  
6.    基本運動知識之介紹  
7.    分組討論及專題報告

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims to nourish students’ interest in squash as a lifelong sport. Contents include the history and development of squash, equipment and venue, basic skills, rules, umpiring, and tactics for playing singles. At the same time, students will improve their fitness, appreciate and practise sportsmanship through participation in the course, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
courses.learning_outcomes:
At the end of the course, students are able to

1. demonstrate basic skills of squash;

2. gain physical fitness through participation in squash;

3. apply the basic tactics of squash in matches;

4. describe the history, rules, scoring, terminology, safety and equipment of the sport of squash;

5. actively participate in squash activities and

6. demonstrate sportsmanship through participation in training and matches.

完成壁球課程後，學生能夠

1. 展示壁球運動的基本能力；

2. 透過壁球運動改善體適能；

3. 運用壁球比賽的基本戰術；

4. 說明有關壁球運動的歷史、比賽規則、計分法、術語、安全守則及器材設施；

5. 積極參與壁球活動；及

6. 於壁球練習賽中展現應有的體育精神。
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. History of squash, introduction of squash court, equipment, sportswear, eye protection and safety rules  
2. The situation of local and international squash events  
3. Warm-up exercise, grips, ball sense exercise and general fitness training  
4. Footwork (ready position, front, back and half court movement)  
5. Drive ( forehand and backhand; front, back and half court; straight and crosscourt drives)  
6. Drop shot (forehand and backhand; front and half court; straight drive)  
7. Volley (forehand and backhand; half court; straight and crosscourt drives)  
8. Boast (forehand and backhand; half court)  
9. Lop Serve (forehand; left and right service boxes)  
10. Return serve  
11. Introduction of rules for a singles competition  
12. Tactics for a singles competition  
  
教學內容  
1、  壁球簡史、球場介紹、球具、服飾、眼睛保護、安全守則  
2、  本地及國際壁球現況  
3、  準備活動、握拍法、球感練習、基本體適能鍛鍊  
4、  步法(準備姿勢、前場、中場及後場移動)  
5、  抽擊球(Drive) (正手及反手；前場、中場及後場；直線及斜線)  
6、  短球(Drop Shot) (正手及反手；前場及中場；直線)  
7、  截擊球(Volley) (正手及反手；中場；直線及斜線)  
8、  側牆球(Boast) (正手及反手；中場)  
9、  高吊發球(Lop Serve) (正手；右及左發球格)  
10、接發球  
11、單打比賽規則介紹及裁判法  
12、單打比賽實戰及策略
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Feedback from students to be collected via course-end evaluation.  
Feedback from students to be collected during the course informally by the teachers.  
Feedback from students to be collected informally via e-mail and CU eLearning System.
courses.recommended_readings:
1. Akyol, M. (2012). Squash for Beginners: Squash Basics. Kindle.

2. Albir G. S. (2017). Anatomy & 100 essential stretching exercises for tennis: And other racket sports, including paddleball, squash, and badminton. Hauppage, 3. NY: Barrons Educational Series, Inc.

4. Beddington, J. (2015). Play Better Squash. G2 Entertainment Ltd.

5. Correa, J. (2015). Creating the Ultimate Squash Player. CreateSpace Independent Publishing Platform.

6. Hirst, P. A. (2011). Squash: Skills Techniques Tactics. The Crowood Press Ltd.

7. Khan, S. (2019). Khan Squash Tips: Tips on How to Excel in the Game of Squash. Independently published.

8. McKenzie, I. (2002). Ian McKenzie’s Squash skills. The Crowood Press Ltd.

9. Murray, S. (2016). The Science of Sport: Squash. The Crowood Press Ltd.

10. Willstrop, J. & Gilmour, R (2012). Shot and a Ghost: a year in the brutal world of professional squash. CPI Group (UK) Ltd.

11. Yarrow, P. & Harrison, A. (2009). Squash: Steps to Success. (2nd Ed.) Human Kinetics Publishers.

3. World Squash Federation. Retrieved from http://www.worldsquash.org/

schedule.class_attributes:
For female only
Can, change to Eng if needed

For female only
Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. This course aims to develop students’ fundamental skills of Soccer needed for lifelong participation in the sport. Contents include: dribbling, passing, heading, shooting, goal keeping, defensive footwork, rules and tactics of the sport, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For female only.
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
courses.learning_outcomes:
At the end of the course, students are able to  
1.  become interested in soccer and acquire basic ball-playing skills (e.g. dribbling, passing, and shooting)  
2.  participate in regular physical exercise and improve the physical fitness  
3.  have an understanding of basic knowledge of soccer including ball-playing skills, rules, terminology, safety and different game formats  
4.  demonstrate analytical and aesthetical ability to watch a soccer match  
5.  improve their interpersonal and social skills and develop a sense of sportsmanship  
6.  demonstrate positive attitudes and values toward sports participation.  
  
完成足球科目後，學生能夠  
1. 增進同學對足球運動興趣，並提昇運動技能 (包括盤、傳、帶及射球等基本技術) 。  
2. 保持持續的運動習慣，及提昇身體適應能力。  
3. 了解足球運動的基本知識、技巧、規則、名詞、安全守則及比賽方法。  
4. 展示出分析足球比賽的能力，能明白及欣賞不同水平聯賽的戰術。  
5. 改善人際及社交技巧，培養體育精神。  
6. 表現出對終身運動有正面態度和價值。
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. History of football and introduction of football court and equipment  
2. Common ways for soccer warm-up and ball sense practice  
3. Basic soccer skills (including ball passing, trapping and controlling, dribbling, heading and shooting, etc.)  
4. Defensive techniques  
5. Throw-in technique, corner kick and free kick techniques  
6. Introduction of goalkeeping techniques and different players' positions and roles  
7. Introduction of soccer formations and tactics in different matches (7 and 11-a-side)  
8. Introduction of Rule -- Offside  
  
教學內容  
1. 足球簡史、球場及球具之介紹  
2. 足球常用熱身及球感練習  
3. 各種足球技巧 (包括傳球、停控球、運球、頭球及射門等)  
4. 防守技術  
5. 界外球、角球及罰球技巧  
6. 基本守門員技術介紹及其他球員位置及職責之介紹  
7. 介紹各比賽 (7人及11人) 的陣式及戰術  
8. 介紹球例—越位

Feedback from students to be collected via course-end evaluation.  
Feedback from students to be collected during the course informally by the lecturers.  
Feedback from students to be collected informally via e-mail and CU eLearning System.

2. 島田信幸, 三森. (2014). 全方位提升戰力: 少年足球培訓手冊. 東販出版.

3. 中國足球協會. (2009). 足球競賽規則 2009/2010. 北京: 人民體育出版社.

4. 霍建明. (2007). 看懂足球. 沈陽出版社.

5. Thadani, S. (2006). SOCCER CONDITIONING. A & C BLACK LONDON.

6. 王增杰. (2006). 世界盃神話: 足球史上最震撼人心的故事. 新華出版社.

7. 劉丹. (2006). 足球體能訓練: 高水平體能訓練與實証. 北京體育大學出版社.

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. This course aims at developing students’ fundamental skills of badminton needed for life long participation in the sport. Contents include: services, overhand shots, underhand shots, forehand shots, backhand shots, footwork, rules and tactics of the sport, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
Not for students who have taken PHED1180.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. History of badminton and introduction of badminton court and equipment  
2. Warm-up exercise and grips  
3. Footwork (backward, hit and forward)  
4. Basic serves (high serve and short serve)  
5. Overhead strokes (forehand clear, smash and drop shot)  
6. Underarm strokes (forehand and backhand lops)  
7. Front court strokes (forehand and backhand net shot), push and receive of serve  
8. Introduction of rules and scoring for both Single and Double competition  
9. Tactics for both Single and Double competition  
  
教學內容  
1. 羽毛球簡史、球場及球具之介紹  
2. 羽毛球熱身運動及握拍法  
3. 步法(退後、擊球及上前)  
4. 基本發球(高遠球及短球)  
5. 上手擊球(正手高遠球、殺球及吊球)  
6. 下手擊球(正、反手挑球)  
7. 網前球、平推球及接發球之練習  
8. 單打及雙打比賽球例介紹及計分法

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students’ fundamental skills and knowledge of table tennis needed for lifelong participation. Contents include: forehand drive, backhand drive, service, service return, forehand loop drive, chop, backhand push and forehand drive from backhand position, footwork, scoring, rules and tactics of the sport, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male olny.
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
Not for students who have taken PHED1140.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. History of table tennis and introduction of table tennis equipment  
2. Specific warm-ups for table tennis, grips (pen-hold and shakehand grip) and ball sense exercise  
3. Basic skills of drive (forehand and backhand)  
4. Basic skills of serve (left sidespin serve, backspin serve and long serve)  
5. Basic skills of returning serve  
6. Basic footwork (side step and cross step)  
7. Introduction of rules and scoring in table tennis competition  
8. Introduction of the manipulation of ball machine  
9. Tactics for table tennis competition  
  
教學內容  
1. 乒乓球簡史及球具介紹  
2. 乒乓球運動熱身方法、握拍法 (直拍及橫拍) 及球感練習  
3. 基本擊球技術 (正手及反手)  
4. 基本發球技術 (左側旋球、下旋球及長球)  
5. 基本接發球技巧 (正手左側旋球、不旋轉球、直線長球及斜線長球)  
6. 基本步法 (併步及交叉步)  
7. 乒乓球比賽球例及計分法之介紹  
8. 講解乒乓球發球機的操作  
9. 乒乓球比賽實戰及基本戰術

2. 唐建軍 (2006)  「圖解乒乓球技巧」  福建科學技術出版社

3. 程云峰、張虹雷 (2015) 「乒乓球運動」  浙江大學出版社

4. 王吉生 (2016)  「跟高手學乒乓-圖解乒乓球進攻技術」  人民體育出版社

5. 張星杰、蔣國強 (2016)  「手把手教你打乒乓球」  人民郵電出版社(北京)

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Yoga
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing student's knowledge and basic skills of yoga for physical activities participation. Practicing yoga can help students to train their mind (including concentration and relaxation) and achieve physical fitness (including flexibility and muscular strength). Moreover, this course will encourage students to have lifelong participation in yoga. Contents of the course include: basic asana of yoga, benefits of practicing yoga, yoga related fitness and establishing a positive attitude towards sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
Not for students who have taken PHED1150.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content   
1. Introduction on Yoga   
2. Safety Precautions for Yoga   
3. Basic stretching for warm-up   
4. Basic techniques on yoga breathing    
5. Asana   
6. Introduction on Meditation   
7. Sun Salutation    
8. Basic Principles on Sequencing   
   
教學內容   
1. 瑜伽運動簡介   
2. 瑜珈注意事項   
3. 熱身基本伸展動作   
4. 基本瑜伽呼吸法   
5. 式子   
6. 冥想介紹   
7. 拜日式   
8. 式子串連基本原則
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Feedback from students to be collected via course-end evaluation.   
Feedback from students to be collected during the course informally by the lecturers.   
Feedback from students to be collected informally via e-mail and CU eLearning System.
courses.recommended_readings:
Reference Books:   
1. Dykema, R. (2011). Yoga for Fitness and Wellness. Belmont, CA: Wadsworth/Cengage Learning.   
2. Coulter, H.D. (2001). Anatomy of Hatha Yoga: A Manual for Students, Teachers, and Practitioners. Honesdale, PA: Body and Breath.   
3. Saradananda, S.(2011). Amazing yoga. London: Flash.   
4. Bo, F. (2011). Yoga for Emotional Balance: Simple Practices to Help Relieve Anxiety and Depression. Boston: Shambhala.   
5. Richard F. (2005). Kripalu Yoga. A Guide to Practice On and Off the Mat. New York: Bantam Dell.   
Website:   
1. Kripalu: http://www.kripalu.org/   
2. Yoga Journal: http://www.yogajournal.com/   
3. YogaWiz.Com: http://www.yogawiz.com/

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Soccer
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. This course aims to develop students’ fundamental skills of Soccer needed for lifelong participation in the sport. Contents include: dribbling, passing, heading, shooting, goal keeping, defensive footwork, rules and tactics of the sport, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Each student can only take one elective course in a term.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. History of football and introduction of football court and equipment  
2. Common ways for soccer warm-up and ball sense practice  
3. Basic soccer skills (including ball passing, trapping and controlling, dribbling, heading and shooting, etc.)  
4. Defensive techniques ( defensive pressure and filling the space created by attackers)  
5. Throw-in technique, corner kick and free kick techniques  
6. Introduction of goalkeeping techniques and different players’ positions and roles  
7. Introduction of soccer formations and tactics in different matches (5, 7 or 11-a-side)  
  
教學內容  
1. 足球簡史、球場及球具之介紹  
2. 足球常用熱身及球感練習  
3. 各種足球技巧 (包括傳球、停控球、運球、頭球及射門等)  
4. 防守技術 (壓迫及補位)  
5. 界外球、角球及罰球技巧  
6. 基本守門員技術介紹及其他球員位置及職責之介紹  
7. 介紹各比賽 (5人、7人及11人) 的陣式及戰術

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Table Tennis
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students’ fundamental skills and knowledge of table tennis needed for lifelong participation. Contents include: forehand drive, backhand drive, serve, return serve, backhand slice, backhand push and inside out forehand drive, footwork, rules and tactics of the sport, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Each student can only take one elective course in a term.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1.      History of table tennis and introduction of table tennis equipment  
2.      Specific warm-ups for table tennis, grips (pen-hold and shakehand grip) and ball sense exercise  
3.      Basic skills of drive (forehand and backhand)  
4.      Basic skills of serve (left sidespin serve, backspin serve and long serve)  
5.      Basic skills of returning serve  
6.      Basic footwork (side step and cross step)  
7.      Introduction of rules and scoring in table tennis competition  
8.      Introduction of the manipulation of ball machine  
9.      Tactics for table tennis competition  
  
教學內容  
1.      乒乓球簡史及球具介紹  
2.      乒乓球運動熱身方法、握拍法 (直拍及橫拍) 及球感練習  
3.      基本擊球技術 (正手及反手)  
4.      基本發球技術 (左側旋球、下旋球及長球)  
5.      基本接發球技巧 (正手左側旋球、不旋轉球、直線長球及斜線長球)  
6.      基本步法 (併步及交叉步)  
7.      乒乓球比賽球例及計分法之介紹  
8.      講解乒乓球發球機的操作  
9.      乒乓球比賽實戰及基本戰術

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Squash
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. It aims to nourish students’ interest in squash as a lifelong sport. Contents include the history and development of squash, equipment and venue, basic skills, rules, umpiring, and tactics for playing singles. At the same time, students will improve their fitness, appreciate and practise sportsmanship through participation in the course, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Each student can only take one elective course in a term.
courses.learning_outcomes:
At the end of the course, students are able to  
1.      demonstrate basic skills of squash;  
2.      gain physical fitness through participation in squash;  
3.      apply the basic tactics of squash in matches;  
4.      describe the history, rules, scoring, terminology, safety and equipment of the sport of squash;  
5.      actively participate in squash activities; and  
6.      demonstrate sportsmanship through participation in training and matches.  
完成壁球科目後，學生能夠  
1.      展示壁球運動的基本能力；  
2.      透過壁球運動改善體適能；  
3.      運用壁球比賽的基本戰術；  
4.      說明有關壁球運動的歷史、比賽規則、計分法、術語、安全守則及器材設施；  
5.      積極參與壁球活動；及  
6.      於壁球練習賽中展現應有的體育精神。
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content

1. History of squash, introduction of squash court, equipment, sportswear, eye protection and safety rules

2. The situation of local and international squash events

3. Warm-up exercise, grips, ball sense exercise and general fitness training

4. Footwork (ready position, front, back and half court movement)

5. Drive (forehand and backhand; front, back and half court; straight and crosscourt drives)

6. Drop shot (forehand and backhand; front and half court; straight drive)

7. Volley (forehand and backhand; half court; straight and crosscourt drives)

8. Boast (forehand and backhand; half court)

9. Lop Serve (forehand; left and right service boxes)

10. Return serve

11. Introduction of rules for a singles competition

12. Tactics for a singles competition

教學內容

1. 壁球簡史、球場介紹、球具、服飾、眼睛保護、安全守則

2. 本地及國際壁球現況

3. 準備活動、握拍法、球感練習、基本體適能鍛鍊

4. 步法(準備姿勢、前場、中場及後場移動)

5. 抽擊球(Drive) (正手及反手；前場、中場及後場；直線及斜線)

6. 短球(Drop Shot) (正手及反手；前場及中場；直線)

7. 截擊球(Volley) (正手及反手；中場；直線及斜線)

8. 側牆球(Boast) (正手及反手；中場)

9. 高吊發球(Lop Serve) (正手；右及左發球格)

10. 接發球

11. 單打比賽規則介紹及裁判法

12. 單打比賽實戰及策略
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Feedback from students to be collected via course-end evaluation.  
Feedback from students to be collected during the course informally by the teachers.  
Feedback from students to be collected informally via e-mail and CU eLearning System.
courses.recommended_readings:
1. Ian McKenzie (2009), The Squash Player. McKenzie Publishing Ltd.  
2. Philip Yarrow, Aidan Harrison, Phillip Yarrow (2009), Squash-  Steps to Success 2nd Edition, Human Kinetics Publishers   
3. Richard Millman, Georgetta Morque (2006), Raising Big Smiling Squash Kids: The Complete Roadmap for Junior Squash. Mansion Grove House   
4. World Squash Federation (2006), The World Squash Handbook. World Squash Federation.  
5. 環馬工作室(2004) 壁球技術，環馬工作室 。  
6. James Zug, George Plimpton (2003), Squash: A History of the Game Book. Scribner Book Company   
7. 蔡玉坤 (2007) 香港壁球總會第一級壁球教練課程講義 香港壁球總會  
8. World Squash Federation (2001). Guide to Understanding the Rules of Squash. Squash Australia.  
  
Hong Kong Squash香港壁球總會           http://www.hksquash.org.hk  
World Squash Federation世界壁球協會      http://www.worldsquash.org.uk/  
Asian Squash Federation亞洲壁球協會      http://www.asiansquash.com/

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Yoga
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing student’s knowledge and basic skills of yoga for physical activities participation. Practicing yoga can help students to train their mind (including concentration and relaxation) and achieve physical fitness (including flexibility and muscular strength). Moreover, this course will encourage students to have lifelong participation in yoga. Contents of the course include: basic asana of yoga, benefits of practicing yoga, yoga related fitness and establishing a positive attitude towards sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Each student can only take one elective course in a term.
Not for students who have taken PHED1160.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content   
1. Introduction on Yoga   
2. Safety Precautions for Yoga   
3. Basic stretching for warm-up   
4. Basic techniques on yoga breathing    
5. Asana   
6. Introduction on Meditation   
7. Sun Salutation    
8. Basic Principles on Sequencing   
   
教學內容   
1. 瑜伽運動簡介   
2. 瑜珈注意事項   
3. 熱身基本伸展動作   
4. 基本瑜伽呼吸法   
5. 式子   
6. 冥想介紹   
7. 拜日式   
8. 式子串連基本原則

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. This course aims to develop students’ fundamental skills and knowledge of Archery needed for life long participation in the game. Content includes Archery safety, fundamental shooting skills, rules of competition, basic skills of using re-curved bow and arrows, proper shooting procedures and aiming target, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Each student can only take one elective course in a term.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. History of archery and introduction of archery equipment and maintenance  
2. Introduction of rules and scoring of the games  
3. Setting up the bow and arrow  
4. Shooting procedures & aiming target  
5. Target shooting in 10, 15, 18, 25 and 30 meters  
  
教學內容  
1. 射箭用具介紹及其護理方法  
2. 射箭比賽規則及計分法之介紹  
3. 上弦搭箭的正確方法  
4. 射箭之正確姿勢及瞄準方法  
5. 10米、18米及25米等距離之射靶練習
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Feedback from students to be collected via course-end evaluation.  
Feedback from students to be collected during the course informally by the lecturers.  
Feedback from students to be collected informally via e-mail and CU eLearning System.
courses.recommended_readings:
1. Wayne C. McKinney, Mike W. McKinney. Archery 8th ed., Brown and Benchmark Publishers, 1997.

2. Hong Kong Archery Association Basic Archery Course Manual Hong Kong Archery Association 2001

3. 中国国家体育总局，射箭，北京市 : 人民体育出版社 2001

4. Stephen Selby. Archery traditions of Asia. Hong Kong Museum of Coastal Defence. 2003

5. Kisik Lee and Robert de Bondt. Total archery. GimPo-City : Samick Sports, c2005.

6. Kathleen M. Haywood, Catherine F. Lewis. Archery: steps to success, Champaign, Ill: Human Kinetics, 2006

7. Lloyd Brown. Archery Instructor Training. USA Archery Association. 2006.

8. Gao, Ying, The way of archery., Atglen, PA : Schiffer Publishing, 2014.

9. Kim, Han-Byul ; Kim, Sae-Hyung ; So, Wi-Young, The Relative Importance of Performance Factors in Korean Archery, Journal of Strength and Conditioning Research, 2015, Vol.29(5), p.1211-1219

10. Spratford, Wayne ; Campbell, Postural stability, clicker reaction time and bow draw force predict performance in elite recurve archery, European Journal of Sport Science, 28 May 2017, Vol.17(5), p.539-545

11. Callaway, Andrew J. ; Wiedlack, Johanna ; Heller, Mario. Identification of temporal factors related to shot performance for indoor recurve archery, Journal of Sports Sciences, 18 June 2017, Vol.35(12), p.1142-1147

參考網址:

HONG KONG ARCHERY ASSOCIATION (香港射箭總會): - http://www.archery.org.hk

WORLD ARCHERY FEDERATION(世界射箭聯盟) : - https://worldarchery.org/

USA ARCHERY (THE NATIONAL ARCHERY ASSOCIATION) (美國射箭總會): - https://www.usarchery.org/

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Tennis
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. This course aims at developing students’ fundamental skills of Tennis needed for life long recreational activities. Contents include basic services, forehand and backhand groundstrokes, net plays, footwork, rules and tactics of singles and doubles matches, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Each students can only take one elective course in a term.
Not for students who have taken PHED1270.
courses.learning_outcomes:
At the end of the course, students are able to   
1. demonstrate the basic skills of tennis   
2. acquire general knowledge of sports    
3. acquire knowledge of the basic rules, scoring, terminology, safety and equipment of tennis    
4. acquire basic knowledge of strategies in tennis    
5. demonstrate positive attitudes and values toward sports participation.   
   
完成網球科目後，學生能夠   
1. 展示網球基本技術   
2. 掌握基本運動常識   
3. 掌握網球運動的基本規則、計分法、名詞、安全守則及設備   
4. 掌握網球戰術的基本知識   
5. 展示對參與運動的正面態度及價值觀
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content

1. History of tennis, introduction of tennis court,equipment, sportswear and safety rules

2. The situation of local and international tennis events

3. Warm-up exercise, grips and practice for ballsense

4. Footwork (ready position, front, back and halfcourt movement)

5. Drive (forehand, backhand and two-handed backhand)

6. Serve (front, back and half court) and balltossing

7. Volley (forehand and backhand)

8. Return serve

9. Introduction of rules and scoring for bothSingle and Double competition

10. Tactics for both Single and Double competition

教學內容

1. 網球簡史、球場介紹、球具、服飾及安全守則

2. 本地及國際網球現況

3. 網球運動熱身方法、握拍法及球感

4. 網球基本步法

5. 正手、反手抽擊球

6. 基本發球技術

7. 正手、反手截擊球

8. 接發球

9. 單打及雙打比賽基本球例及計分法介紹

10. 單打及雙打比賽基本戰術
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Feedback from students to be collected via course-end evaluation.   
Feedback from students to be collected during the course informally by the lecturers.   
Feedback from students to be collected informally via e-mail and CU eLearning System.

1.神谷胜則 (2013)。《實用網球技巧提升200》。遼寧科學技術出版社

2. Jim M. Brown, & Camille Soulier, (2013). Tennis: Steps to Success Human Kinetics

3. Nick Bollettieri, (2015). Nick Bollettieri's Tennis Handbook Human Kinetics

4. Marty Smith, (2017). Absolute Tennis : The Best And Next Way To Play The Game New Chapter Press, U.S

5. John Parsons, (2018). The Ultimate Encyclopedia of Tennis Carlton

6. International Tennis Federation, (2022). Rules of Tennis ITF

7. https://www.itftennis.com/media/7221/2024-rules-of-tennis-english.pdf

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Badminton
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. This course aims at developing students’ fundamental skills of badminton needed for life long participation in the sport. Contents include: services, overhand shots, underhand shots, forehand shots, backhand shots, footwork, rules and tactics of the sport, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Each students can only take one elective course in a term.
Not for students who have taken PHED1280.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content   
1. History of badminton and introduction of badminton court and equipment   
2. Warm-up exercise and grips   
3. Footwork (backward, hit and forward)   
4. Basic serves (high serve and short serve)   
5. Overhead strokes (forehand clear, smash and drop shot)   
6. Underarm strokes (forehand and backhand lops)   
7. Front court strokes (forehand and backhand net shot), push and receive of serve   
8. Introduction of rules and scoring for both Single and Double competition   
9. Tactics for both Single and Double competition   
教學內容   
1. 羽毛球簡史、球場及球具之介紹   
2. 羽毛球熱身運動及握拍法   
3. 步法(退後、擊球及上前)   
4. 基本發球(高遠球及短球)   
5. 上手擊球(正手高遠球、殺球及吊球)   
6.下手擊球(正、反手挑球)   
7. 網前球、平推球及接發球之練習   
8. 單打及雙打比賽球例介紹及計分法   
9.單打及雙打比賽實戰及戰術
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Feedback from students to be collected via course-end evaluation.   
Feedback from students to be collected during the course informally by the lecturers.   
Feedback from students to be collected informally via e-mail and CU eLearning System.
courses.recommended_readings:
1. Downay, J. C. (1982) Better Badminton for All. Pelham Books.

2. Wattanasin, C. (1989) Badminton, a simple way. International Badminton Federation.

3. 傅漢洵等 (1985) 怎樣打羽毛球 人民體育出版社

4. 課程發展署(1994) 中學體育科教學資料(第二版) 香港教育署, 課程發展署

5. 王悅譯 (2005) 羽毛球教學 北京体育大學出版社

6. Lin Jiancheng (2007) Yu mao qiu gong lüe,Jiao liu chu ban she.

7. Liu Ruihao (2007) Yu mao qiu xin shou xun lian ban = Basic badminton, Wan li shu dian

8. 刘瑞豪(2008) 羽毛球基礎與實戰技巧 成都時代出版社

9. 舛田圭太(2018) 日本國家代表隊教練舛田圭太的羽球基本技術全解析台灣東販股份有限公司

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Woodball
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. This course aims at developing students’ fundamental skills of woodball needed for life long participation in the sport. Contents include: shooting, half swing, full swing, tactics and rules of the game, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Each student can only take one elective course in a term.
courses.course_syllabus:

10. 12-Gates (Single and Double) Fairway Competitions

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Tai Chi
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing student’s knowledge, basic skills and application of Tai Chi for physical activities participation. Practicing Tai Chi can help students to achieve physical and mental health, in addition to train for physical fitness, but also for their mind (including concentration and relaxation). Moreover, students can practice Tai Chi as a life-time sport.The course contents are included: basic skills of Tai Chi, benefits of practicing Tai Chi, Tai Chi related fitness and establishing a positive attitude towards sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Each student can only take one elective course in a term.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content

1. Introduction on the basic knowledge of Tai Chi

2. Introduction on Tai Chi "Hands, Eyes, Body, Step"

3. Basic Techniques on Legs and Hands Practice

4. All 24 Styles of simplified Tai Chi Chuan

5. Application of all Styles

6. Push Hand

教學內容

1. 太極拳運動的基本常識

2. 太極拳的「手、眼、身、步」

3. 基本步樁和手法的練習

4. 全套24式簡化太極拳

5. 全套各式應用

6. 介紹推手

Feedback from students to be collected via course-end evaluation.  
Feedback from students to be collected during the course informally by the teachers.

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Taekwondo

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students’ knowledge, basic skills, Poomsae and self-defence techniques for Taekwondo. Practicing taekwondo can help students to achieve physical fitness (including flexibility, muscular strength, balance, etc), and protect themselves from various dangerous situations. Moreover, this course will encourage students to have lifelong participation in taekwondo. Contents of the course include: basic technique of taekwondo, etiquette of taekwondo, taekwondo related fitness and rules of taekwondo competition, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Each student can only take one elective course in a term.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. History and development of Taekwondo  
2. Introduction of Taekwondo and related etiquette  
3. Stretching and warm-up for taekwondo  
4. Basic stance and steps  
5. Punch  
6. Higher, Middle, Lower Section Block  
7. Slip kick, Side kick, Turning kick, Axe kick, Back kick  
8. Targets kicking  
9. Combination of kicks  
10. Hand knife  
11. Back Fist  
12. Introduction of Poomsae ‘Pattern I’  
13. Introduction of Protective gears and Kick with Truck Protectors  
14. Front side kick, front turning kick  
15. Rolling side kick and Rolling turning kick  
16. Faking techniques  
17. Punch techniques  
18. Counter attacks  
19. Defensive skills  
20. Free sparring practice  
21. Basic tactics in free sparring

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students’ knowledge, basic skills, Poomsae and self-defence techniques for Taekwondo. Practicing taekwondo can help students to achieve physical fitness (including flexibility, muscular strength, balance, etc), and protect themselves from various dangerous situations. Moreover, this course will encourage students to have lifelong participation in taekwondo. Contents of the course include: basic technique of taekwondo, etiquette of taekwondo, taekwondo related fitness and rules of taekwondo competition, etc.

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing student’s knowledge, basic skills and application of Tai Chi Chuan for physical activities participation. Practicing Tai Chi Chuan can help students to achieve physical and mental health, in addition to train for physical fitness, but also for their mind (including concentration and relaxation). Moreover, students can practice Tai Chi Chuan as a life-time sport.The course contents are included: basic skills of Tai Chi Chuan, benefits of practicing Tai Chi Chuan, Tai Chi Chuan related fitness and establishing a positive attitude towards sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content

1. Introduction on the basic knowledge of Tai Chi

2. Introduction on Tai Chi "Hands, Eyes, Body, Step"

3. Basic Techniques on Legs and Hands Practice

4. All 24 Styles of simplified Tai Chi Chuan

5. Application of all Styles

6. Push Hand

教學內容

1. 太極拳運動的基本常識

2. 太極拳的「手、眼、身、步」

3. 基本步樁和手法的練習

4. 全套24式簡化太極拳

5. 全套各式應用

6. 介紹推手

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students’ basic technique of modern dance and dance choreography. With different dance technique training exercises and dance routines, students can improve their flexibility, coordination, musicality, energy transferal, spatial awareness and performing skills . Dance choreography focus on the process in creating and self-discovery. It encourages students to share and express their feelings and thoughts with body movement. Dance performance is required at the end of the course and students can learn the basic stage knowledge and performing skills.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
courses.learning_outcomes:
At the end of the course, students are able to:  
1. demonstrate the basic technique of modern dance  
2. understand the history and development of modern dance  
3. activate their creativity  
4. gain interest in performing arts   
5. enhance their self-affirmation and confidence  
  
完成本科後，學生能夠：  
1.展示現代舞基礎技巧  
2.了解現代舞的歷史及發展  
3.透過舞蹈創作激發創作思維  
4.增加對舞蹈藝術的欣賞和感興  
5.透過舞蹈表演加強對自我的肯定和自信
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. Body posture: Standing position, Body alignment  
2. Dance technique introduction  
3. Swing and weight transfer exercise  
4. Modern dance video (Modern dance intro., Dance structure, Dance theatre, Duo, Improvisation)  
5. Floor work exercise  
6. Dance routine  
7. Fall and recovery exercise  
8. Improvisation  
9. Group choreography  
  
教學內容  
1. 身體姿勢: 站立位置, 身體正列  
2. 基訓鍛鍊練習  
3. 擺盪和重心轉移練習  
4. 舞蹈影片欣賞 （現代舞認知、舞蹈結構變化、舞蹈劇場、雙人舞、即興）  
5. 地板動作練習  
6. 舞蹈組合  
7. 跌落與回復練習  
8. 舞蹈即興  
9. 舞蹈創作

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed
Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students’ fundamental skills and knowledge of table tennis needed for lifelong participation. Contents include: forehand drive, backhand drive, service, service return, forehand loop drive, chop, backhand push and forehand drive from backhand position, footwork, scoring, rules and tactics of the sport, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
Not for students who have taken PHED1043 and PHED1044.
courses.learning_outcomes:
At the end of the course, students are able to:  
1. demonstrate basic skills of table tennis  
2. gain physical fitness through participation in table tennis  
3. apply the basic tactics of table tennis in competitions  
4. describe the history, rules, scoring, terminology, safety and equipment of the sport of table tennis  
5. demonstrate sportsmanship through participation in training and competitions  
6. demonstrate positive attitudes and values toward sports participation  
  
完成乒乓球科目後，學生能夠：  
1. 展示乒乓球基本技術  
2. 透過參與乒乓球運動改善體適能  
3. 於比賽時運用基本乒乓球策略  
4. 掌握乒乓球運動的歷史、基本規則、計分法、名詞、安全守則及設備  
5. 透過參與訓練及比賽培養體育精神  
6. 培養對參與運動的正面態度及價值觀
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. History of table tennis and introduction of table tennis equipment  
2. Specific warm-ups for table tennis, grips (pen-hold and shakehand grip) and ball sense exercise  
3. Basic skills of drive (forehand and backhand)  
4. Basic skills of serve (left sidespin serve, backspin serve and long serve)  
5. Basic skills of returning serve  
6. Basic footwork (side step and cross step)  
7. Introduction of rules and scoring in table tennis competition  
8. Introduction of the manipulation of ball machine  
9. Tactics for table tennis competition  
  
教學內容  
1. 乒乓球簡史及球具介紹  
2. 乒乓球運動熱身方法、握拍法 (直拍及橫拍) 及球感練習  
3. 基本擊球技術 (正手及反手)  
4. 基本發球技術 (左側旋球、下旋球及長球)  
5. 基本接發球技巧 (正手左側旋球、不旋轉球、直線長球及斜線長球)  
6. 基本步法 (併步及交叉步)  
7. 乒乓球比賽球例及計分法之介紹  
8. 講解乒乓球發球機的操作  
9. 乒乓球比賽實戰及基本戰術

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Tennis
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. This course aims at developing students' fundamental skills of Tennis needed for life long recreational activities. Contents include: basic services, forehand and backhand ground strokes, net plays, footwork, rules and tactics of singles and doubles matches, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
Not for students who have taken PHED1031 and PHED1032.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content:

1. History of tennis, introduction of tennis court, equipment, sportswear and safety rules

2. The situation of local and international tennis events

3. Tennis sports specific warm-up exercise, grips and practice for ball sense

4. Basic tennis footwork

5. Forehand and backhand drive

6. Basin tennis serve technique

7. Forehand and backhand volley

8. Return of serve

9. Introduction of basic rules and scoring for both Single and Double competition

10. Basic tactics for both Single and Double competition

教學內容

1.  網球簡史、球場介紹、球具、服飾及安全守則

2.  本地及國際網球現況

3.  網球運動熱身方法、握拍法及球感練習

4.  步法(準備姿勢、前、中及後場移動)

5.  抽擊球(Drive)(正手、反手及雙手反拍)

6.  基本發球(Serve) (前、中及後場)、投擲及拋球動作練習

7.  截擊球(Volley)(正手及反手)

8.  接發球

9. 單打及雙打比賽基本球例及計分法介紹

10. 單打及雙打比賽基本戰術

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Karate
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the elective Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students’ knowledge on karate e.g. basic skills, kata, kumite and self-defence techniques for karate. Practicing karate can help students to achieve physical fitness (including cardiovascular endurance, muscular strength and endurance, balance, agility, flexibility etc.), and protect themselves from various dangerous situations. Moreover, this course will encourage students to have lifelong participation in karate. Contents of the course include: karate basic techniques, etiquette and attitude, karate related fitness and competition rules, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Each student can only take one elective course in a term.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content:   
1. History, development and etiquette of Karate  
2. Introduction of Karate – Kata & Kumite  
3. Stretching and warm-up for Karate  
4. Basic stances and move i.e. parallel, three battle, front and square stances  
5. Basic hand attack i.e. upper, middle, lower punch  
6. Basic hand defense i.e. upper, middle, lower block  
7. Basic kick attack i.e. front, side and roundhouse kick  
8. Different stances moving with attack and defense  
9. Introduction and Bunkai (analysis) of Goju Ryu kata “Geksai Dai Ichi”  
10. Kata performance  
11. Kumite sparring form, steps and moving steps.  
12. Introduction of protective gears  
13. Kumite front and back hand punches attack and defense  
14. Kumite front, side and back leg kick attack and defense  
15. 1 on 1 sparring  
16. Introduction of kata & kumite rules and regulations  
17. Introduction of competition uniform and equipment requirement  
18. Introduction of competition strategy & tactics  
  
教學內容：  
1. 空手道之歷史發展及禮儀規範  
2. 空手道 - 形與組手之介紹  
3. 空手道專項熱身動作   
4. 基本馬步站樁及移動﹕平衡立、三戰立、前屈立、四股立  
5. 基本手部攻擊﹕上、中、下段直拳  
6. 基本手部防守﹕上、中、下段擋  
7. 基本腳部攻擊﹕前踢、側踢、迴旋踢  
8. 不同基本馬步配合進攻防守  
9. 介紹及分解剛柔流形擊碎一  
10. 形比賽演練  
11.組手搏擊擺莊、跳步及跳動  
12. 護具及手靶使用  
13. 組手前手、後手打頭打身進攻與防守  
14. 組手前腳、側踢、後腳踢頭踢身進攻與防守  
15. 一對一實戰練習  
16. 介紹形與組手比賽規則及裁判法  
17. 介紹比賽服飾、裝備要求  
18. 介紹比賽戰略與策略

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Cycling and Fitness
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students' knowledge and basic skills of cycling for physical activity participation. Cycling can help students to train their coordination and achieve physical fitness. Moreover, this course will encourage students to have lifelong participation in cycling.Contents of the course include: 1) basic skills of cycling including bicycle control, handling, turning, gear shifting, ascending and descending; 2) cycling gears and equipment; 3) safety in cycling and; 4) cycling fitness.

8. Cycling fitness training  
9. Bike path introduction

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Physical Conditioning

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed
Can, change to Eng if needed
Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students’ fundamental fitness concepts and an option as a lifelong physical activity. Contents of this course include basic concepts of physical fitness, exercise safety, basic techniques of using fitness room facilities, basic principles of exercise prescription, basic knowledge and techniques of fitness testing, basic knowledge to choose the appropriate exercise mode and design fitness programmes, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward lifelong physical activity participation etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
Not for students who have taken PHED1017 and PHED1018.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. Explain the definition of Health-related Physical Fitness and its effect  
2. Introduction and practice of warm-ups and stretching exercises on major muscle groups  
3. Introduction and training methods of aerobic exercise  
4. Introduction and practice of jogging and cool down exercises  
5. Introduction of safety, rules and regulations of using fitness room  
6. Introduction and practicum of aerobic machines and resistance training equipment  
7. Explaining the concepts of Body Composition and Weight Control  
8. Introduction of the Principles of Interval Training and Circuit Training  
9. Exercise Prescription of Cardio-respiratory Endurance and Muscular Fitness (FITT)  
10. Introduction of the Concept of "Life Long Activity" and implementation of a Personal Exercise Prescription Programme  
  
教學內容  
1. 說明健康體適能的意義及功效  
2. 熱身運動介紹及身體各主要肌群伸展之介紹及練習  
3. 有氧運動介紹及鍛鍊方法  
4. 緩步跑及緩和運動之介紹和練習  
5. 健身室安全使用守則之介紹  
6. 健身室器械之介紹和實習  
7. 解釋身體肥瘦組合及體重控制的概念  
8. 間歇訓練及循環訓練原理之介紹及實習  
9. 介紹心肺耐力及肌肉適能的運動處方(FITT)  
10. 「終生運動」概念的介紹及個人運動處方的安排和實踐

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Basketball
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. This course aims at developing students’ fundamental skills of Basketball needed for lifelong participation in the sport. Contents include: footwork, passing, dribbling, shooting, defensive skill, tactics and rules of the game, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Each student can only take one elective course in a term.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. History of basketball, introduction of basketball court and equipment  
2. Footwork, ball sense exercise and different pass and receiving skills  
3. Dribbling (High, Control and Cross dribble)  
4. Set shots and jump shots (one-hand and two-hand)  
5. Drive and lay-up shots  
6. Skills of blocking and rebounding  
7. Introduction of low post skills  
8. Basic passing game (Give-and-go, Penetrate & pass, Screening and Flash)  
9. Basic tactics in defensive situation (Squeeze, fight, over, slide through, help, trap and recover)  
10. Introduction of basic rules (violation & foul), referee signals and refereeing  
  
教學內容  
1. 籃球簡史、球場及球具之介紹  
2. 籃球步法、球感練習及各種傳接球技術  
3. 運球（高運球、低運球、體前變向運球）  
4. 原地及跳起投籃（單手及雙手）  
5. 運球上籃技術（單手低手及單手肩上）  
6. 搶位及籃板球技術  
7. 底位球員動作介紹及練習  
8. 基礎戰術配合（傳切配合、突分配合、掩護配合及策應配合）  
9. 基礎防守配合（擠過、穿過、繞過配合、關門、夾擊及補防）  
10. 球例、基本球証手號及球証裁判法之介紹

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Hip-hop Dance
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. It aims to develop students' knowledge and basic hip-hop dance skills, promote physical fitness and motor coordination, and enhance their generic skills such as creative thinking, communication, and team collaboration. Contents of the course include: basic groove, basic foundations, basic routines and choreography, hip-hop dance related fitness and establishing a positive attitude towards sports participation, and so on. The dance performance is required as an assessment at the end of the course, and students can learn basic performing knowledge and skills.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Each student can only take one elective course in a term.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content:  
1. Introduction of Hip-hop dance  
2. Music rhythm  
3. Basic groove: Bounce  
4. Basic groove: Rock  
5. Basic groove: Slide  
6. Basic groove: Isolation  
7. Basic steps  
8. Dance routines  
9. Structural choreography: Lines  
10. Structural choreography: Layers  
11. Structural choreography: Transition  
12. Structural choreography: Poses  
13. Structural choreography practice

1. 嘻哈舞介紹  
2. 音樂節奏  
3. 基礎律動-彈動  
4. 基礎律動-搖擺  
5. 基礎律動-滑步  
6. 基礎律動-身體分離  
7. 基礎腳步  
8. 舞蹈組合  
9. 舞蹈結構編排-隊形  
10. 舞蹈結構編排-層次  
11. 舞蹈結構編排-過渡

13. 練習舞蹈結構編排

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Golf
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. This course aims at developing students’ fundamental skills of golf needed for lifelong participation in the sport. Contents include: The history, origins, and rules of golf, swing motion of irons and short game with priority order, course strategy and dynamic warm-up, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Each student can only take one elective course in a term.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content:  
1. Introduction to three ways of Gripping, posture of Short and Long game, Address  
2. Introduction to Irons  
3. Introduction to Golf Etiquette  
4. Introduction to the Rules and Course Regulations (18 holes with a total par of 72: including 4 par 5 holes, 4 par 3 holes and 10 par 4 holes)  
5. Difference between Driving Range and Competition Course  
6. Introduction to Competition Strategies  
7. Introduction to 14 clubs in the golf-bag (woods, irons, and wedge)  
8. Introduction to Characteristics of golf and Benefits of its challenges  
9. Competitive mode: Stroke play rules  
10. Competitive mode: Match play rules  
  
教學內容﹕  
1. 介紹三種握桿方法、短桿和長桿站姿、瞄球姿勢  
2. 介紹鐵桿  
3. 介紹高爾夫球運動的禮儀  
4. 介紹球場規則 (共72總桿18洞，並劃分為﹕4個5桿洞、4個3桿洞及10個4桿洞)  
5. 練習場及比賽用場區別  
6. 介紹比賽策略與運用  
7. 介紹球袋內14支球桿 (木桿、鐵桿及短桿)  
8. 介紹高爾夫球運動的特點及其挑戰之益處  
9. 比賽模式﹕個人桿數賽  
10. 比賽模式﹕團隊賽

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Judo

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed
Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. It aims to develop students' strength, speed, physical fitness, and body coordination. The various movements of Judo involve multiple muscle groups of the body, which can increase muscle strength. On the other hand, Judo focuses on etiquette and decent character, which can cultivate good behaviour, such as athletes' willpower, perseverance and respect for others in the long run. The contents of the course include: the basic techniques, rules and free sparring. Through learning Judo, students will understand the importance of sports and physical health and develop the habit of doing exercise. The assessment of the course is based on demonstration and breakfall, which helps students learn the basic standing techniques, pinning techniques and breakfall techniques of Judo.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Each student can only take one elective course in a term.

6. 6 basic pinning techniques

7. Gripping techniques

8. Introduction to Judo rules and refereeing rules

9. Free sparring techniques

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Tennis
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. This course aims at developing students’ fundamental skills of Tennis needed for life long recreational activities. Contents include basic services, forehand and backhand groundstrokes, net plays, footwork, rules and tactics of singles and doubles matches, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Each students can only take one elective course in a term.
Not for students who have taken PHED1071 or PHED1072.
courses.learning_outcomes:
At the end of the course, students are able to   
1. demonstrate the basic skills of tennis   
2. acquire general knowledge of sports    
3. acquire knowledge of the basic rules, scoring, terminology, safety and equipment of tennis    
4. acquire basic knowledge of strategies in tennis    
5. demonstrate positive attitudes and values toward sports participation.   
   
完成網球科目後，學生能夠   
1. 展示網球基本技術   
2. 掌握基本運動常識   
3. 掌握網球運動的基本規則、計分法、名詞、安全守則及設備   
4. 掌握網球戰術的基本知識   
5. 展示對參與運動的正面態度及價值觀
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content

1. History of tennis, introduction of tennis court,equipment, sportswear and safety rules

2. The situation of local and international tennis events

3. Warm-up exercise, grips and practice for ballsense

4. Footwork (ready position, front, back and halfcourt movement)

5. Drive (forehand, backhand and two-handed backhand)

6. Serve (front, back and half court) and balltossing

7. Volley (forehand and backhand)

8. Return serve

9. Introduction of rules and scoring for bothSingle and Double competition

10. Tactics for both Single and Double competition

教學內容

1. 網球簡史、球場介紹、球具、服飾及安全守則

2. 本地及國際網球現況

3. 網球運動熱身方法、握拍法及球感

4. 網球基本步法

5. 正手、反手抽擊球

6. 基本發球技術

7. 正手、反手截擊球

8. 接發球

9. 單打及雙打比賽基本球例及計分法介紹

10. 單打及雙打比賽基本戰術

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Badminton
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. This course aims at developing students’ fundamental skills of badminton needed for life long participation in the sport. Contents include: services, overhand shots, underhand shots, forehand shots, backhand shots, footwork, rules and tactics of the sport, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Each students can only take one elective course in a term.
Not for students who have taken PHED1073 or PHED1074.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content   
1. History of badminton and introduction of badminton court and equipment   
2. Warm-up exercise and grips    
3. Footwork (backward, hit and forward)   
4. Basic serves (high serve and short serve)   
5. Overhead strokes (forehand clear, smash and drop shot)   
6. Underarm strokes (forehand and backhand lops)   
7. Front court strokes (forehand and backhand net shot), push and receive of serve   
8. Introduction of rules and scoring for both Single and Double competition   
9. Tactics for both Single and Double competition   
    
教學內容   
1.羽毛球簡史、球場及球具之介紹   
2. 羽毛球熱身運動及握拍法   
3.步法(退後、擊球及上前)   
4. 基本發球(高遠球及短球)   
5. 上手擊球(正手高遠球、殺球及吊球)   
6.下手擊球(正、反手挑球)   
7. 網前球、平推球及接發球之練習   
8. 單打及雙打比賽球例介紹及計分法   
9.單打及雙打比賽實戰及戰術

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Cycling and Fitness

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing student’s knowledge and basic skills of cycling for physical activities participation. Cycling can help students to train their coordination and achieve physical fitness. Moreover, this course will encourage students to have lifelong participation in cycling. Contents of the course include: 1) basic skills of cycling including bicycle control, handling, turning, gear shifting, ascending and descending slopes2) cycling gears and equipment; 3) safety in cycling and 4) cycling fitness training
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content:

1. Cycling history and development

2. Cycling equipment

3. Cycling rules and safety

4. Cycling stretching and warm-up exercises

5. Bike balance and coordination

6. Gear shifting, brakes control, ascending and descending slopes, turning

7. Indoor bike machine introduction

8. Cycling fitness training

9. Bike path introduction

10. Introduction of cycling competition

11. Introduction of cycling training program

教學內容：

1. 單車運動的歷史與發展

2. 單車運動的裝備

3. 單車運動的規則和安全

4. 單車運動的拉伸和熱身運動

5. 單車平衡與協調

6. 單車換檔、剎車控制、上下坡、轉彎

7. 室內單車介紹

8. 單車運動健身訓練

9. 單車道介紹

10. 單車運動比賽介紹

11. 單車運動及體能訓練計劃介紹

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Track and Field

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed
Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Required Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students’ fundamental skills of track and field, arousing students’ interests towards athletics and nurturing initiative of physical activities which are needed for life long participation in the sports activities. Content include: techniques, postures and rules of running, jumping and throwing events, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
Not for PESH and ESHE Majors.
Not for IASP students.
Not for students who have taken PHED1011 and PHED1012.
courses.learning_outcomes:
On completion of this course, students will be able to:

1.  acquire the basic skills in different track and field athletic events

2.  participate in regular exercise and improve physical fitness

3.  understand the basic track and field knowledge including skills, rules and safety

4.  develop interest in athletics participation and demonstrate the sense of sportsmanship

5.  show the analytical and aesthetical ability to watch and appreciate the athletics meet

完成田徑課程後，學生能夠

1.掌握不同田徑項目的基本技巧。

2.保持持續的運動習慣，及提昇體適能。

3.了解田徑運動的基本技巧、規則及安全守則。

4.培養參與田徑運動的興趣並展示體育精神。

5.展示出分析田徑比賽的能力，能明白及欣賞不同水平比賽。
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content:

1. General sports knowledge and safety of track and field events

2. Basic skills of sprint ( start, acceleration and finish techniques)

3. Basic skills of shot put ( shot from a standing position facing forward, sideway and using the glide technique)

4. Basic skills of long jump (arm and leg actions of the hang technique in the aerial phase and landing phase)

5. Basic skills of javelin (methods of gripping the javelin and the release of the throw)

6. Introduction and practice of high jump and hurdles

教學內容:

1. 基本運動知識及田徑運動安全守則

2. 短跑基本技巧 (起跑、中途跑及最後衝刺之技巧)

3. 沿球基本技巧 (正向原地推球、側向原地推球及背向原地推球)

4. 跳遠基本技巧 (助跑、騰空動作及落地方法)

5. 標槍基本技巧 (握槍、持槍方法及最後出槍動作)

6. 跳高及跨欄介紹及練習

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Physical Conditioning
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students’ fundamental fitness concepts and an option as a lifelong physical activity. Contents of this course include basic concepts of physical fitness, exercise safety, basic techniques of using fitness room facilities, basic principles of exercise prescription, basic knowledge and techniques of fitness testing, basic knowledge to choose the appropriate exercise mode and design fitness programmes, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward lifelong physical activity participation etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Each student can only take one elective course in a term.
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. Explain the definition of Health-related Physical Fitness and its effect  
2. Introduction and practice of warm-ups and stretching exercises on major muscle groups  
3. Introduction and training methods of aerobic exercise  
4. Introduction and practice of jogging and cool down exercises  
5. Introduction of safety, rules and regulations of using fitness room  
6. Introduction and practicum of aerobic machines and resistance training equipment  
7. Explaining the concepts of Body Composition and Weight Control  
8. Introduction of the Principles of Interval Training and Circuit Training  
9. Exercise Prescription of Cardio-respiratory Endurance and Muscular Fitness (FITT)  
10. Introduction of the Concept of "Life Long Activity" and implementation of a Personal Exercise Prescription Programme  
  
教學內容  
1. 說明健康體適能的意義及功效  
2. 熱身運動介紹及身體各主要肌群伸展之介紹及練習  
3. 有氧運動介紹及鍛鍊方法  
4. 緩步跑及緩和運動之介紹和練習  
5. 健身室安全使用守則之介紹  
6. 健身室器械之介紹和實習  
7. 解釋身體肥瘦組合及體重控制的概念  
8. 間歇訓練及循環訓練原理之介紹及實習  
9. 介紹心肺耐力及肌肉適能的運動處方(FITT)  
10. 「終生運動」概念的介紹及個人運動處方的安排和實踐

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Intermediate Basketball
courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. This course aims at developing students’ intermediate skills of Basketball needed for lifelong participation in the sport. Contents include: footwork, passing, dribbling, shooting, defensive skill, defence tactics, offence tactics and rules of the game, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
For male only.
Each student can only take one elective course in a term.
courses.learning_outcomes:
At the end of the course, students are able to  
1. demonstrate basic and intermediate skills of basketball  
2. acquire general knowledge of sports  
3. acquire knowledge of basic rules, scoring, terminology, safety and equipment of basketball  
4. acquire intermediate knowledge of offensive and defensive strategies in basketball  
5. demonstrate positive attitudes and values toward sports participation  
  
完成籃球科目後，學生能夠  
1. 展示籃球基本和中級技術  
2. 掌握基本運動常識  
3. 掌握籃球運動的基本規則、計分法、名詞、安全守則及設備  
4. 掌握中級攻防戰術的基本知識  
5. 展示對參與運動的正面態度及價值觀
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. Ball sense exercise  
2. Footwork and movement  
3. Triple-threat position  
4. Pass and receiving skills (including Moving pairs passing & catching)  
5. Set shots & Jump shot (one-hand and two-hand)  
6. Dribbling (High, Control, Cross dribble)  
7. Drive and lay-up shots (overhand / underhand)  
8. Defensive footwork  
9. 3 on 3  
10. Rebounding  
11. Refereeing  
12. Fast-break  
13. Zone defence & Zone offence  
14. Man to Man defence & Man to Man offence  
15. Base line out of bound plays  
16. Full court 5 on 5  
  
教學內容  
1. 球感練習  
2. 步法及移動  
3. 護球及三脅勢動作  
4. 各種傳接球技術（包括行進間傳接）  
5. 原地及跳起投籃（單手、雙手）  
6. 運球 （高運球、低運球、體前變向運球）  
7. 運球及持球突破上籃（單手低手/ 單手肩上）  
8. 防守步法  
9. 三人籃球比賽  
10. 籃板球技術  
11. 裁判手號  
12. 長傳快攻練習  
13. 區域聯防及進攻區域聯防  
14. 人盯人防守及進攻人盯人戰術  
15. 籃底界外球戰術  
16. 全場5對5

Feedback from students to be collected via course-end evaluation.  
Feedback from students to be collected during the course informally by the lecturers.  
Feedback from students to be collected informally via e-mail and CU eLearning System.

2. 郭永波 (2005) 籃球運動教程  北京體育大學出版社

3. 張秀華 劉玉林 (2008) 籃球系統戰術  國家出版社

courses.subject: PHED
courses.title: Intermediate Table Tennis

schedule.class_attributes: Can, change to Eng if needed

courses.description: This course is offered as one of the courses under the Elective Physical Education Programme. It aims at developing students’ intermediate level skills and knowledge of table tennis needed for lifelong activity. Contents include: forehand drive, backhand drive, service, service return, forehand topspin, backhand slice, backhand push and inside out forehand drive, footwork, scoring, rules and tactics of the sport, nurturing positive attitudes and values toward sports participation, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Each student can only take one elective course in a term.
courses.learning_outcomes:
At the end of the course, students are able to:  
1. demonstrate intermediate skills in table tennis  
2. gain physical fitness through participation in table tennis   
3. apply table tennis skills and tactics in competitions   
4. describe the history, rules, scoring, terminology, safety and equipment of the sport of table tennis  
5. demonstrate sportsmanship through participation in training and competitions  
6. demonstrate positive attitudes and values toward sports participation   
  
完成乒乓球科目後，學生能夠：  
1. 展示乒乓球進階技術  
2. 透過參與乒乓球運動改善體適能   
3. 於比賽時運用乒乓球的技術和戰術  
4. 掌握乒乓球運動的歷史、基本規則、計分法、術語、安全守則及設備  
5. 透過參與訓練及比賽培養體育精神  
6. 培養對參與運動的正面態度及價值觀
courses.course_syllabus:
Teaching Content  
1. Introduction to general knowledge and terminology in table tennis  
2. Holding a racquet (Penhold Grip and Shakehand Grip)  
3. Introduction and practice to forehand topspin  
4. Backhand drive  
5. Backhand slice  
6. Forehand drive alternated with backhand drive  
7. Backhand drive alternated with inside out forehand, and cross step forehand drive  
8. Forehand topspin alternated with backhand drive  
9. Forehand backspin serve  
10. Introduction to doubles (rules)  
11. Backhand backspin serve  
12. Forehand backspin short serve  
13. Forehand serve with left side spin  
14. Serve and attack  
15. Return serve and attack  
  
教學內容  
1. 介紹乒乓球運動的常識及述語  
2. 握拍法(直拍及橫拍)  
3. 正手拉上旋球  
4. 反手擊球  
5. 反手搓(下旋)球  
6. 正手擊球結合反手擊球  
7. 反手、側身擊球、撲正手  
8. 正手拉上旋球結合反手擊球  
9. 正手發下旋球  
10. 介紹乒乓球雙打的基本規則  
11. 反手發下旋球  
12. 正手發下旋短球  
13. 正手發左側旋轉球  
14. 發球搶攻  
15. 接發球搶攻

2. 王梅生、安瑛 (2005) 「體育課程—乒乓球教學」 北京體育大學出版社

3. 唐建軍 (2005) 「乒乓球技巧圖解」 北京體育大學出版社

4. 韓志忠 (2006) 「乒乓球教學、訓練、競賽與科研」 人民體育出版社

7. 程云峰、張虹雷 (2015) 「乒乓球運動」 浙江大學出版社
